title: Which of these is correct, full form or long form? - Quora

response.answer_text: You’ll hear “long form” more often, but that doesn’t mean “full form” will never be correct. In the US, the Internal Revenue Service gives some taxpayers the option of filing a “short form” to report their income; the form that’s used by other taxpayers is commonly called the “long form,” although that’s not the official name for it. I can imagine an industry, institution or profession having something that’s customarily called a “full form” by the people who use it every day. One dictionary says that the words “full form” can refer to a type of insurance coverage.
